data.title: The 10 Largest-Cap Growth Stocks
data.text: Investors know it's not easy to find companies already worth tens of billions that can still expand their revenues rapidly. But these giants show it's not impossible.

data.title: 3 Reasons to Play the Patient Game with Facebook Stock
data.text: The panic over the severity of the U.S.-China trade war has dropped many investments, including Facebook stock.

data.title: Feds look to pull Facebook user data
data.text: The Justice Department is seeking user data from social media platforms in an effort to avoid further tragedies as were seen in Dayton and El Paso. Will this affect Facebook's value?

data.title: FBI looking to pull vast amounts of data off Big Tech
data.text: Yahoo FInance's Alexis Keenan reports on the efforts by the FBI to gather information off social media sites.  The Wall Street Journal says the bureau is looking to pull "vast quantities" of public data off Facebook, Twitter and other social media. This could violate those companies' privacy policies.

data.title: Court rejects Facebook appeal to throw out privacy lawsuit
data.text: Facebook's attempt to throw out a class action lawsuit over its use of facial recognition technology has been rejected.

data.title: Facebook confirms 'news tab' being launched in US
data.text: Facebook has confirmed it will be launching a "news tab" in the US following reports it has begun to contact media companies to license their stories, but the company remains a competitor to most of them.

data.title: Facebook wants to give you a dedicated news section
data.text: The social network reportedly wants to deliver "trustworthy news."

data.title: Facebook facial recognition lawsuit can proceed – US court
data.text: Firm will appeal against action that could expose it to billions of dollars in potential damages
